sect2.title: Introduction to cURL
sect2.para: The cURL package contains curl and its support library. This is useful for transferring files with URL syntax. This ability to both download and redirect files can be incorporated into other programs to support functions like streaming media.

sect2.title: Installation of cURL
sect2.para: Install cURL by running the following commands:

userinput.command: ./configure --prefix=/usr && make && make install && find docs -name "Makefile*" \ -o -name "*.1" \ -o -name "*.3" | xargs rm && install -v -d -m755 /usr/share/doc/curl-&curl-version; && cp -v -R docs/* /usr/share/doc/curl-&curl-version;

sect2.title: Command explanations
sect2.para: --with-gssapi=/usr: This parameter adds Kerberos 5 support to libcurl.

sect2.title: Contents
sect2.para: The cURL package contains curl, curl-config and the libcurl libraries.

sect3.title: curl
sect3.para: curl is a client that can get documents from or send documents to any of the following protocols: HTTP, HTTPS (needs ), FTP, GOPHER, DICT, TELNET, LDAP (needs ) or FILE.

sect3.title: curl-config
sect3.para: curl-config prints information about the last compile, like libraries linked to and prefix setting.

sect3.title: libcurl
sect3.para: libcurl provides the functionality of curl to other programs.
